00008 // modified 13-AUG-1998 to handle output as well as input
00009 // 29 Dec 1998 - reads only the string representation of vertices
00010 //               (converting vertices to integers is done in the BiGraph class)

00032 #ifndef DOT_H
00033 #define DOT_H
00034 
00035 using namespace std;
00036 
00037 #include<iostream>
00038 
00039 void init_dot( istream & in );
00040 // PRE: 'in' is at the beginning of a dot file description
00041 // POST: 'in' is at the beginning of the first statement inside {}'s
00042 
00043 bool next_edge( istream & in, const char * & u, const char * & v );
00044 // PRE: 'in' is at the beginning of a dot statement S
00045 // POST: 'in' is just beyond the next statement starting with S that
00046 //       describes an edge; (u,v) is the edge, where u and v are C-strings
00047 //       (not allocated and not guaranteed to be there after the next call
00048 //       to this function)
00049 //       retval == true if and only if there is another statement
00050 //                 describing an edge  
00051 
00052 // To extract edges from a dot file in stdin, use the following type of loop:
00053 //
00054 //     const char * u;
00055 //     const char * v;
00056 //     init_dot(cin);
00057 //     while ( next_edge( cin, u, v ) ) {
00058 //       // do something with edge (u,v)
00059 //     }
00060 
00061 void dot_preamble( ostream & out, const char * graph_name,
00062                    const char * seed_info = "" );
00063 // POST: the preamble for a graph with the given name has been emitted to
00064 //       'out' and the seed info added as a comment
00065 
00066 void end_dot( ostream & out );
00067 // POST: output indicating the end of a dot graph has been sent to 'out'
00068 
00069 void output_edge( ostream & out,
00070                   const char * u, const char * v );
00071 // POST: a dot statement for the edge (u,v) has been sent to 'out'
00072 
00073 #endif
